column2: **Censoring data is dangerous business.** If you are going to censor an outlier, make sure to document **how** you discovered the outlier, **why** you believe it should be censored, and **"whether or not that censoring had an effect on your results/conclusions"**.  Then make sure to broadcast your thinking to everyone who comes in contact with your report.  If you try to hide your outliers, you are being unethical and setting yourself up for disaster.
